19.text: layering. Granodiorites and monzogranites outcrop extensively throughout tenement E31/564.

text:
This report details exploration carried out on the One Tree tenement Project E31/564 during 
 the  reporting  period  02/03/2005  to  01/03/2006.  Jackson  Gold  is  the  beneficial  and/or 
 registered  holder  of  the  tenement.  The  One  Tree  Project  is  located  approximately  130  km 
 northeast of Kalgoorlie (Figure 1). The Project area lies between Lake Rebecca to the south 
 and Lake Raeside to the north and is located 13 km to the north-northwest of the Porphyry 
 Gold Mine. The tenement is located on the Edjudina 1:250 000 Sheet (H 51-06) and is situated 
 in  the  Yerilla  District  of  the  North  Coolgardie  Mineral  Field.  Access  to  the  project  area  is 
 either via the Kalgoorlie- Yarri – Mount Celia Road or the  Kalgoorlie -  Pinjin – Edjudina 
 The  tenement  lies  within  the  Mulgabbie  domain  of  the  Kurnalpi  terrane.  In  this  terrane, 
 greenstone  units  form  a  west-dipping  homoclinal  sequence  that  has  been  dissected  by  late, 
 north-trending faults. The Mulgabbie domain comprises metamorphosed mafic volcanics and 
 intrusives,  predominantly  amphibolite  and  metabasalt,  minor  ultramafics  and  biotite 
 monzogranite plutons. Granitoids emplaced prior to regional folding are interpreted to have 
 intruded  the  Yarri  Domain  greenstones  as  sheets  conformable  with  overall  greenstone 
 layering. Granodiorites and monzogranites outcrop extensively throughout tenement E31/564. 
 Tenement E31/564 is part of a package of tenements which formed Gutnick Resources NL’s 
 Pinjin Project.  Jackson Gold entered a tenement trade with Gutnick Resources for tenure in 
 the South Laverton Tectonic Zone which included E31/564. This exploration licence is now 
 100% held by Jackson Resources.  
 Exploration  activities  included  soil  auger  sampling,  regolith  mapping  and  geochemical  data 
 processing (Figure 2). 
 2

13.text: Access  to  the  project  area  is  either  via  the  Kalgoorlie-  Yarri  –  Mount  Celia  Road  or  the

14.text: Kalgoorlie - Pinjin – Edjudina road. Topography is subdued and the maximum relief is less

15.text: than 150m. The physiography is to a large extent related to the underlying geology. Northwest

16.text: –striking ridges are underlain by mafic rocks and banded iron-formations. Areas underlain by

17.text: greenstones and granitoids are gently undulating with plateaus of laterite and highly weathered

18.text: bedrock.  Lake  Rebecca  and  Lake  Raeside  form  two  prominent  salt-lake  drainage  systems,

19.text: stretching from northwest to southeast. The lakes are flanked by dunes separating small lakes

Access  to  the  project  area  is  either  via  the  Kalgoorlie-  Yarri  –  Mount  Celia  Road  or  the 
 Kalgoorlie - Pinjin – Edjudina road. Topography is subdued and the maximum relief is less 
 than 150m. The physiography is to a large extent related to the underlying geology. Northwest 
 –striking ridges are underlain by mafic rocks and banded iron-formations. Areas underlain by 
 greenstones and granitoids are gently undulating with plateaus of laterite and highly weathered 
 bedrock.  Lake  Rebecca  and  Lake  Raeside  form  two  prominent  salt-lake  drainage  systems, 
 stretching from northwest to southeast. The lakes are flanked by dunes separating small lakes

22.text: sequences with thin and/ or discontinuous ultramafic (komatiite) layers. Within both domains,

23.text: low angle regional shear zones bound or truncate lithologic- stratigraphic packages. The Barba

24.text: Hills  Domain  lies  on  the  eastern  limb  of  a  regional  anticline,  the  core  of  which  is  largely

25.text: represented  by  an  extensive  granitoid  complex.  The  Yarri  Domain  appears  to  form  a  west-

29.text: Domain  greenstones  as  sheets  conformable  with  overall  greenstone  layering.  Tenement

30.text: E31/566  overlies  one  of  these  granitoid  sheets.    Post-regional  folding  granitoids  tend  to  be

31.text: ovoid to slightly ellipsoidal in outcrop pattern, they include the Porphyry Quartz Monzonite.

35.text: Granodiorites  and  monzogranites  outcrop  extensively  throughout  tenement  E31/564.  A

36.text: narrow,  north-northwest  striking  belt  of  quartz sericite schists passes through Granite Well.

38.text: rafters  of  felsic  or  volcaniclastic  units  (Brigden,  1997).  Minor  rafters  of  amphibolites  are

text:
Both  the  Barba  Hills  and  Yarri  Domains  contain  several  basaltic  and  felsic  volcaniclastic 
 sequences with thin and/ or discontinuous ultramafic (komatiite) layers. Within both domains, 
 low angle regional shear zones bound or truncate lithologic- stratigraphic packages. The Barba 
 Hills  Domain  lies  on  the  eastern  limb  of  a  regional  anticline,  the  core  of  which  is  largely 
 represented  by  an  extensive  granitoid  complex.  The  Yarri  Domain  appears  to  form  a  west-
 dipping homoclinal sequence. 
 Granitoids  emplaced  prior  to  regional  folding  are  interpreted  to  have  intruded  the  Yarri 
 Domain  greenstones  as  sheets  conformable  with  overall  greenstone  layering.  Tenement 
 E31/566  overlies  one  of  these  granitoid  sheets.    Post-regional  folding  granitoids  tend  to  be 
 ovoid to slightly ellipsoidal in outcrop pattern, they include the Porphyry Quartz Monzonite. 
 Granodiorites  and  monzogranites  outcrop  extensively  throughout  tenement  E31/564.  A 
 narrow,  north-northwest  striking  belt  of  quartz sericite schists passes through Granite Well. 
 These rocks are considered to represent either ultramylonites after granites or highly deformed 
 rafters  of  felsic  or  volcaniclastic  units  (Brigden,  1997).  Minor  rafters  of  amphibolites  are 
 evident within the granodiorite body. 
 Quartz  veining  is  common  throughout  the  granitoids.  (Brigden,  1997).  Blue-grey  veining 
 occurred in the spoil from Granite Well.

9.text: The main line of workings within the Yarri Monzogranite, almost 1500 m long, encompasses

10.text: the  more  or  less  contiguous  workings  at  Wallaby  North,  Wallaby  Central,  and  Yarri

11.text: Proprietary. The workings have exposed a 330 – 340o –trending, subvertical to steeply west

12.text: dipping  shear  zone  that  is  more  or  less  conformable  within  the  regional  foliation.  The

13.text: mineralized shears are commonly located at the margins of prominent quartz veins of similar

14.text: orientation. They represent zones of relatively high strain that may have been localized by the

15.text: contrast in competency between the veins and the wall rocks. Farther south, the mafic-hosted

16.text: workings at Star of Yarri (Beatrice) and Queens Birthday, appear to lie on a different trend to

17.text: that defined by the monzogranite-hosted deposits. The structure at Yarri South is a steeply east

18.text: dipping, banded brittle-ductile shear zone (Roberts, F.I. et al, 2000).

21.text: within  the  Porphyry  Quartz  Monzonite.  The  Porphyry  shear  zone,  which  cuts  the  eastern

22.text: margin  of  the  intrusion,  is  approximately  25m  wide.  Gold  is  localized  in  a  series  of  en

23.text: echeolon lenses, with the highest grades contained within mylonitic zones about 10cm thick

24.text: (Swager, 1995). The alteration mineralogy is quartz-muscovite-pyrite, and probably includes

25.text: fine-grained hematite produced at a late stage of mineralisation. The low-grade Million Dollar

26.text: mineralized shear occurs some 350 m above the Porphyry shear and two kilometres south of

text:
The main line of workings within the Yarri Monzogranite, almost 1500 m long, encompasses 
 the  more  or  less  contiguous  workings  at  Wallaby  North,  Wallaby  Central,  and  Yarri 
 Proprietary. The workings have exposed a 330 – 340o –trending, subvertical to steeply west 
 dipping  shear  zone  that  is  more  or  less  conformable  within  the  regional  foliation.  The 
 mineralized shears are commonly located at the margins of prominent quartz veins of similar 
 orientation. They represent zones of relatively high strain that may have been localized by the 
 contrast in competency between the veins and the wall rocks. Farther south, the mafic-hosted 
 workings at Star of Yarri (Beatrice) and Queens Birthday, appear to lie on a different trend to 
 that defined by the monzogranite-hosted deposits. The structure at Yarri South is a steeply east 
 dipping, banded brittle-ductile shear zone (Roberts, F.I. et al, 2000).  
 The Porphyry and Million Dollar deposits occur within two 20o - 25o east-dipping shear zones 
 within  the  Porphyry  Quartz  Monzonite.  The  Porphyry  shear  zone,  which  cuts  the  eastern 
 margin  of  the  intrusion,  is  approximately  25m  wide.  Gold  is  localized  in  a  series  of  en 
 echeolon lenses, with the highest grades contained within mylonitic zones about 10cm thick 
 (Swager, 1995). The alteration mineralogy is quartz-muscovite-pyrite, and probably includes 
 fine-grained hematite produced at a late stage of mineralisation. The low-grade Million Dollar 
 mineralized shear occurs some 350 m above the Porphyry shear and two kilometres south of 
 The surface cover over the majority of tenement E31/564 consists of red sandy soils which are 
 Aeolian in part, and granite derived sandy soils forming the remainder. The cover sequences 
 are  heavily  indurated  by  hardpan  development,  as  observed  in  an  old  water  well  along  the 
 Granite Well to Forrest Well track (Bridgen, 1997). The regolith in the area is shown in the 
 Landsat TM Image (Figure 4).   
 It is evident from the regional aeromagnetic data that the majority of the structures trend in a 
 northwest  direction,  parallel  to  stratigraphy  (Figure  5.)  The  low  angle  regional  shear  zones 
 bound or truncate lithologic – stratigraphic packages.  
 The  post-regional  folding  granitoids,  including  the  one  underlying  the  southern  portion  of 
 tenement E31/654 are clearly evident in the aeromagnetic data from their ellipsoidal signature. 
 Granitoids, including the one underlying the northern portion of tenement E31/564, emplaced 
 prior to regional folding occur as magnetically quiet areas, which are generally conformable 
 with overall greenstone layering.  
 9

3.text: The  Porphyry  mine  was  the  only  major  producer  (about  4.5  Mt)  in  the  area.  The  Yarri

4.text: Monzogranite has produced about 460 kg of gold, mainly from the Wallaby Central and Yarri

5.text: Proprietary  mines.  Smaller  amounts  of  gold  have  come  from  mafic-hosted  deposits  in  the

6.text: country  rocks.  The  main  contributor  was  the  amphibolite-hosted  Yarri  South  mine  which

7.text: produced 40 kg of gold (Roberts, F.I. et al, 2000).

text:
The  Porphyry  mine  was  the  only  major  producer  (about  4.5  Mt)  in  the  area.  The  Yarri 
 Monzogranite has produced about 460 kg of gold, mainly from the Wallaby Central and Yarri 
 Proprietary  mines.  Smaller  amounts  of  gold  have  come  from  mafic-hosted  deposits  in  the 
 country  rocks.  The  main  contributor  was  the  amphibolite-hosted  Yarri  South  mine  which 
 produced 40 kg of gold (Roberts, F.I. et al, 2000).

29.text: Southern Ventures NL conducted exploration over a large package of ground including the

30.text: area  now  occupied  by  tenement  E31/564,  during  the  period  1985  to  1989.  Colour  aerial

31.text: photography and aeromagnetics were flown over the area however no targets were defined. No

32.text: other exploration undertaken fell over tenement E31/566.  Southern Ventures NL concluded

33.text: that although the area had not been tested in detail, sufficient work had been undertaken to

34.text: discount any major economic gold occurrence.

43.text: The southern half of Pancontinental Mining Pty Oak Well Gold Project covered tenement

44.text: E31/564. Exploration, during the period 1990 to 1993, was conducted to target shear-hosted

45.text: gold mineralisation associated with splays off the Keith Kilkenny Tectonic Zone. The RAB

46.text: drilling and reconnaissance soil sampling undertaken by Pancontinental Mining Pty was not

47.text: conducted in the area now covered by tenement E31/564. It was concluded that the weak gold

48.text: anomalism delineated from geochemical exploration did not warrant further investigation.

57.text: Sons  of  Gwalia’s  Norman  Well  tenement  covered  the  south  eastern  corner  of  tenement

58.text: E31/564. Exploration between 1990 and 2001 comprised data acquisition, data review, GIS,

59.text: aeromagnetic  interpretation,  soil  sampling  and  RAB/RC  drilling.  Regional  soil  sampling,

60.text: which involved the blanket coverage of the project area was conducted, and included the area

61.text: now  covered  by  E31/564.  No  drilling  was  undertaken  on  tenement  E31/564.  Further

62.text: exploration was required and due to the age of the tenement, a mining lease application was

63.text: made and the Norman Well tenement was surrendered.

text:
Edjudina gold exploration 
 1985 - 1989 
 Southern Ventures NL 
 Southern Ventures NL conducted exploration over a large package of ground including the 
 area  now  occupied  by  tenement  E31/564,  during  the  period  1985  to  1989.  Colour  aerial 
 photography and aeromagnetics were flown over the area however no targets were defined. No 
 other exploration undertaken fell over tenement E31/566.  Southern Ventures NL concluded 
 that although the area had not been tested in detail, sufficient work had been undertaken to 
 discount any major economic gold occurrence. 
 Oak Well gold exploration 
   
 7448, 8340 
 1990 - 1993 
 Pancontinental Mining Pty 
 The southern half of Pancontinental Mining Pty Oak Well Gold Project covered tenement 
 E31/564. Exploration, during the period 1990 to 1993, was conducted to target shear-hosted 
 gold mineralisation associated with splays off the Keith Kilkenny Tectonic Zone. The RAB 
 drilling and reconnaissance soil sampling undertaken by Pancontinental Mining Pty was not 
 conducted in the area now covered by tenement E31/564. It was concluded that the weak gold 
 anomalism delineated from geochemical exploration did not warrant further investigation. 
 Norman Well gold exploration 
 1990 - 20001 
 Sons of Gwalia 
 Sons  of  Gwalia’s  Norman  Well  tenement  covered  the  south  eastern  corner  of  tenement 
 E31/564. Exploration between 1990 and 2001 comprised data acquisition, data review, GIS, 
 aeromagnetic  interpretation,  soil  sampling  and  RAB/RC  drilling.  Regional  soil  sampling, 
 which involved the blanket coverage of the project area was conducted, and included the area 
 now  covered  by  E31/564.  No  drilling  was  undertaken  on  tenement  E31/564.  Further 
 exploration was required and due to the age of the tenement, a mining lease application was 
 made and the Norman Well tenement was surrendered. 
 12

19.text: significant gold reserves at the Porphyry deposit.

14.text: the  early  1970’s  when  the  areas  underlain  by  ultramafic  rocks  were  examined  for  nickel

 the  early  1970’s  when  the  areas  underlain  by  ultramafic  rocks  were  examined  for  nickel

23.text: Regolith mapping was conducted over Jackson Gold’s One Tree Project including the majority

24.text: of tenement E31/564. The mapping was undertaken at a scale of 1: 25 000 by consultant Jonno

25.text: King. The mapping has been digitally captured and is presented in Figure 6. This landform

26.text: interpretation  exercise  was  conducted  over  the  project  area  with  a  view  to  normalising  the

27.text: surface geochemistry and generating exploration targets

32.text: Statistical  levelling  of  the  gold  from  the  surface  geochemical  database  which  includes  both

33.text: historical and recent sampling conducted by Jackson Gold for the One Tree Project area, has

34.text: been  conducted  by  Jonno  King  during  the  2005  work  year.  The  geochemical  data  set

35.text: comprises numerous discrete surveys or batches, the presence of differing backgrounds and

36.text: thresholds  commonly  causes  ‘edge  effects’  that  can  obscure  real  data  trends.  Levelling

37.text: involves a statistical manipulation of the data so as to minimize batch effects which include

38.text: different sample media, sampling methods, digestion and analytical techniques and laboratory

39.text: batch results. Levelling of the data generated several new trends and anomalies and in some

40.text: case  a  better  –  constrained  existing  anomalies.  The  levelled  gold  geochemistry  data  is

text:
Inferred  resources  have  also  been  estimated  in  several  meta-andesite  hosted  deposits  to  the 
 east of Porphyry, including Margaret (about 1000 kg Au) and Enterprise (about 2000 kg Au). 
 A small inferred resource (about 200 kg Au) has been estimated at Porphyry North (Roberts, 
 5.0. Exploration Activities 
 5.1 Regolith Mapping 
 Regolith mapping was conducted over Jackson Gold’s One Tree Project including the majority  
 of tenement E31/564. The mapping was undertaken at a scale of 1: 25 000 by consultant Jonno 
 King. The mapping has been digitally captured and is presented in Figure 6. This landform 
 interpretation  exercise  was  conducted  over  the  project  area  with  a  view  to  normalising  the 
 surface geochemistry and generating exploration targets 
 5.2 Geochemical Data Processing  
 Statistical  levelling  of  the  gold  from  the  surface  geochemical  database  which  includes  both  
 historical and recent sampling conducted by Jackson Gold for the One Tree Project area, has 
 been  conducted  by  Jonno  King  during  the  2005  work  year.  The  geochemical  data  set 
 comprises numerous discrete surveys or batches, the presence of differing backgrounds and 
 thresholds  commonly  causes  ‘edge  effects’  that  can  obscure  real  data  trends.  Levelling 
 involves a statistical manipulation of the data so as to minimize batch effects which include 
 different sample media, sampling methods, digestion and analytical techniques and laboratory 
 batch results. Levelling of the data generated several new trends and anomalies and in some 
 case  a  better  –  constrained  existing  anomalies.  The  levelled  gold  geochemistry  data  is

text:
The Yarri Monzogranite has produced about 460 kg of gold, mainly from the Wallaby Central 
 and Yarri Proprietary mines. Smaller amounts of gold have come from mafic-hosted deposits, 
 the main contributor was the amphibolite-hosted Yarri South mine which produced 40 kg of 
 gold (Roberts, F.I. et al, 2000). 
 Significant  quantities  of  gold  have  been  extracted  from  deposits  hosted  by  the  Porphyry 
 Quartz Monzonite.  Porphyry and Million Dollar have produced greater than 4 t of Au. Present

 During the 2005 - 2006 reporting period Jackson Gold continued to monitor and regulate the 
 environmental impact of its exploration activities.  This was achieved through the continual 
 use  of  our  internal  compliance  audit  program.    All  activities  were  undertaken  with  those 
 guidelines  set  by  the  Department  of  Industry  and  Resources  as  a  minimum.    Through  its 
 Environmental  Policy,  Jackson  Gold  is  committed  to  managing  its  activities  in  an 
 environmentally responsible manner and actively pursues environmental excellence.
